s.text: This musical adaptation of an 18 th -century French farce about a princess who courts a philosopher is the season's surprise success.
This musical adaptation of an 18 th -century French farce about a princess who courts a philosopher is the season's surprise success.

Others say the film has the "earnest simplicity of a freshman philosophy paper" (Jack Mathews, the Los Angeles Times ) and "ends in the cheesiest of plot twists" (Rita Kempley, the Washington Post ). (Stills and clips are available here.)
